alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Garza; Kent (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 8:03PM CDT until June 30 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Dickens, Garza, Kent, King and Stonewall. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms resulting in very high rain rates. The West Texas Mesonet site at Lake Alan Henry recorded 0.40 inches of rain in only 5 minutes. Rain rates this high will result in minor flooding which is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spur, Jayton, Lake Alan Henry, Girard, Clairemont, Peacock, Swenson and Justiceburg.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
